poem:
### Shadows of Deceit

In the corridors where truth  
is a ghost, whispers play  
their cruel game. An oath  
tarnished, justice sways  
like an unhinged door.  
Promises fold as paper,  
fragile in the wind,  
while trust slips through  
cracks, a reluctant shadow  
lost in a labyrinth of lies.

Although there was no “deliberate attempt” to mislead, the high court held that MI5’s subsequent explanations could not be relied on". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
